hints_html:
Use a trigonometric identity to prepare the integrand for a substitution.

Use the identity

\(\sin^2x=1-\cos^2x.\)
hints_latex:
Use a trigonometric identity to prepare the integrand for a
substitution.
hints_raw:
Use a trigonometric identity to prepare the integrand for a substitution.
Use the identity

<math> \sin^2x=1-\cos^2x. </math>
question: 2 (b)
sols_html:
\[\begin{aligned} I_2&=\int \sin^3x\cos^2 x\, dx =\int (1-\cos^2 x)\cos^2x \sin x\, dx\end{aligned}\]

Let \(u=\cos x\) so that \(du=-\sin x dx.\) Then

\[\begin{aligned} I_2&=-\int (1-u^2 )u^2 \, du = \int (u^4-u^2 ) \, du\\ &= \frac15u^5-\frac13u^3 +C= \frac15\cos^5x-\frac13\cos^3x +C\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
<math> \begin{align}
I_2&=\int \sin^3x\cos^2 x\, dx =\int (1-\cos^2 x)\cos^2x \sin x\, dx
\end{align}</math>

Let <math>u=\cos x </math> so that <math>du=-\sin x dx. </math>  Then

<math> \begin{align}
I_2& =-\int (1-u^2 )u^2 \, du = \int (u^4-u^2 ) \, du\\
&= \frac15u^5-\frac13u^3  +C= \frac15\cos^5x-\frac13\cos^3x  +C
\end{align}</math>
statement_html:
Evaluate the integral (Hint: use trigonometric identities.)

\(I_2 = \int (\sin x)^3 (\cos x)^2\,dx.\)
statement_latex:
Evaluate the integral (Hint: use trigonometric identities.)

$I_2 = \int (\sin x)^3 (\cos x)^2\,dx.$
statement_raw:
Evaluate the integral (Hint: use trigonometric identities.)

<math>I_2 = \int (\sin x)^3 (\cos x)^2\,dx.</math>
